'''Nokia Software Updater''' is a [[Windows]] based application from [[Nokia]] that enables customers to update their mobile device [[firmware]] of a recent [[Nokia Series 40|Series 40]] or [[S60 platform|S60]] device from any [[Internet]] enabled access point. As of 8th May 2008, the developers of the program have removed support for the Windows Vista operating system, citing 'compatibility problems' as the reason for doing so. This is a issue of great frustration for a large proportion of home users who are currently on Vista and as a result can no longer update their phone's firmware.
+
'''Nokia Software Updater''' is a [[Windows]] based application from [[Nokia]] that enables customers to update their mobile device [[firmware]] of a recent [[Nokia Series 40|Series 40]] or [[S60 platform|S60]] device from any [[Internet]] enabled access point. As of 8th May 2008, the developers of the program have removed support for the Windows Vista operating system, citing 'compatibility problems' as the reason for doing so. This is a issue of great frustration for a large proportion of home users who are currently on Vista and as a result can no longer update their phone's firmware, unlesss using a Virtual Machine with Windows XP, like [[VMware Workstation]], connect the phone to the Virtual Machine, and then, run the update process from there.
The full list of supported phones is available in the official site.
The full list of supported phones is available in the official site.
